page.title: 18RIVER COLNE
page.content: The survey area is composed of glacial gravels overlying thick beds of London Clay within which Septarian Nodules occur These harden on exposure and were used as building stone by Romans and Normans. The flint gravels originated as extensive outwash deposits laid down by the melting ice-sheets which extended towards this area 900,000 years ago. The Colne Valley was carved deeply into the London clay by outwash rivers adjusted to a lower sea-level. The Post-Glacial rise in sea-level led to the drowning of the valley to form a branching estuary or RIA. The whole Essex coastline is sinking at one inch in a hundred years. This is the delayed isostatic sinking compensating for the rise in Scotland- the main source area of the ice-sheets
